entry.title: What is the best Cream Soda?
The Official CRSI Wigga-Meter
entry.summary: What is the Wigga-Meter The Wigga-Meter is a conceptual framework designed to quantify and analyze the WiggerFactor: a probabilistic metric…
entry.content:
What is the Wigga-Meter

The Wigga-Meter is a conceptual framework designed to quantify and analyze the WiggerFactor: a probabilistic metric assessing the likelihood of encountering individuals exhibiting Wigger-like traits and behaviors based on environmental and occupational factors.

How it Works

The Wigga-Meter employs a standardized 1-25 scale to quantify the relative intensity of the WiggerFactor in observable subjects. Each categorical data point gets a max of 5 points with a 6 point bonus for extremely common factors. Approximately 30 jobs/locations were studied.

Data Points

NWAL (Natural Wigger Appearance Likelihood)

  • Quantifies the likelihood of an organic encounter in a public setting.

WEC (Wigger Employment Chance)

  • Quantifies the likelihood of a wigger individual being employed within or affiliated with the specified occupation or setting.

BSA (Bluetooth Speaker Allowance)

  • Measures the social and situational tolerance for an individual to play music publicly via a portable Bluetooth speaker within the specified setting.

FFP (Free Food/Drink Probability)

  • Estimates the likelihood of complimentary consumables at a given location, which correspondingly elevates the probability of wigger presence and encounter frequency.

SB (Stereotype Bonus)

  • Assigns additional weight to locations that reinforce or align with established wigger stereotypes.
